name: kryo-5.3.0
body:
This is a maintenance release coming with bug fixes and performance improvements:

#872 Custom exception for buffer over/underflow (#874)
#873 Set record component getter accessible (#875)
#845 Performance improvements for maps (#876)
#845 Use IdentityMap instead of CuckooObjectMap in class resolver (#877)
#882 Catch LinkageError in addition to RTE when accessing fields via ASM (#883)

Other Tasks:
- Enforce minimum maven version and update plugins and test dependencies

The full list of changes can be found [here](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/compare/kryo-parent-5.2.1...kryo-parent-5.3.0).

Many thanks to all contributors! 

## Upgrade Notes

This release brings performance improvements for Kryo's custom map implementations (#876). These improvements allowed us to change the map for resolving registrations in `DefaultClassResolver` from a `CuckooObjectMap` to an `IdentityMap` with 3-5% faster throughput (#877). `CuckooObjectMap` is now deprecated and will be removed in Kryo 6.

Kryo now throws dedicated exceptions in case of buffer under- or overflows (#872). If you currently parse the error message to check for these conditions, you can catch `KryoBufferUnderflowException` and `KryoBufferOverflowException` instead.

For migration from previous major versions please check out the [migration guide](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/wiki/Migration-to-v5). We're asking the community to help and contribute this part: please edit the migration wiki page as you encounter any information or issues that might help others.

### Compatibility
- Serialization compatible
  - Standard IO: Yes
  - Unsafe-based IO: Yes
- Binary compatible - No ([Details](https://rawgithub.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/master/compat_reports/kryo/5.2.1_to_5.3.0/compat_report.html))
- Source compatible - No ([Details](https://rawgithub.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/master/compat_reports/kryo/5.2.1_to_5.3.0/compat_report.html#Source))

name: kryo-5.2.1
body:
This is a maintenance release coming with bug fixes and improvements:

#834 Support skipping input chunks after a buffer underflow (#850)
#865 Ensure empty PriorityQueue can be deserialized (#866)
#870 Shade contents of source jar for versioned artifact 

Other Tasks:
- Migrate from Travis CI to GitHub Actions
- Build and test with JDK 17

name: kryo-5.2.0
body:
This is a maintenance release coming with bug fixes and improvements. 

#849 Fall back to getDeclaredConstructor for non-public records
#848 Fix #847 Ensure that RecordSerializer can deal with subtypes
#841 Fix #840 Ensure primitive types are assignable to Comparable/Serializables fields
#839 Fix #838 Avoid flush repeatedly when has finished flushing
#829 OSS-Fuzz Integration

The full list of changes can be found [here](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/compare/kryo-parent-5.1.1...kryo-parent-5.2.0).

Many thanks to all contributors! 

### Important Upgrade Information

This release fixes two critical issues with the serializer for `java.util.Record`. One of the issues (#847) seriously limits the serializers practical usefulness, so we decided to make an exception and break serialization compatibility. If you have serialized records with non-final field types that you need to read with Kryo 5.2.0, you can enable backwards compatibility globally or for individual types (recommended):

1. Register global default serializer:

```
    final RecordSerializer<?> rs = new RecordSerializer<>();
    rs.setFixedFieldTypes(true);
    kryo.addDefaultSerializer(Record.class, rs);
```

2. Register serializer per type:

```
    final RecordSerializer<?> rs = new RecordSerializer<>();
    rs.setFixedFieldTypes(true);
    kryo.register(MyRecord.class, rs);
```

For migration from previous major versions please check out the [migration guide](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/wiki/Migration-to-v5). We're asking the community to help and contribute this part: please edit the migration wiki page as you encounter any information or issues that might help others.

### Compatibility
- Serialization compatible
  - Standard IO: Yes (except for `java.util.Record`)
  - Unsafe-based IO: Yes (except for `java.util.Record`)
- Binary compatible - Yes ([Details](https://rawgithub.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/master/compat_reports/kryo/5.1.1_to_5.2.0/compat_report.html))
- Source compatible - Yes ([Details](https://rawgithub.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/master/compat_reports/kryo/5.1.1_to_5.2.0/compat_report.html#Source))

name: kryo-5.1.1
body:
This is a maintenance release coming with bug fixes for `CompatibleFieldSerializer` and the versioned artifact. 

In Kryo 5.1.0, a direct dependency on the unversioned JAR accidentally made it into the POM for the versioned artifact (see #825). If you are using the versioned artifact, upgrading to 5.1.1 is recommended.

#822: Fix #821 Support closures when validating types in CompatibleFieldSerializer
#824: Fix #823 Fix ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException in binary search logic
#825: Remove direct dependency from versioned artifact

The full list of changes can be found [here](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/compare/kryo-parent-5.1.0...kryo-parent-5.1.1).

Many thanks to all contributors! 

For migration from previous major versions please check out the [migration guide](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/wiki/Migration-to-v5). We're asking the community to help and contribute this part: please edit the migration wiki page as you encounter any information or issues that might help others.

  - Standard IO: Yes
  - Unsafe-based IO: Yes
- Binary compatible - Yes ([Details](https://rawgithub.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/master/compat_reports/kryo/5.1.0_to_5.1.1/compat_report.html))
- Source compatible - Yes ([Details](https://rawgithub.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/master/compat_reports/kryo/5.1.0_to_5.1.1/compat_report.html#Source))

name: kryo-5.0.1

#777: Fix #776 Automatic module name
#779: Dependency Upgrades

name: kryo-5.0.0
body:
This is the final release of the new major version 5.0.0 of Kryo (see also the [RC1 release notes](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/releases/tag/kryo-parent-5.0.0-RC1) for major changes of v5).

This version comes with only minor changes on top of RC9 (the list of changes from RC9 can be found [here](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/compare/kryo-parent-5.0.0-RC9...kryo-parent-5.0.0)).
For a detailed list of changes to 4.x please go though the release notes for the release candidates for kryo 5.

For migration from previous major versions please check out the [migration guide](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/wiki/Migration-to-v5). We're asking the community to help and contribute this part: please edit the migration wiki page as you encounter any information or issues that might help others.

### Compatibility
Due to big changes 5.0.0 is both source/binary incompatible and serialization incompatible to previous major versions - for details see [the RC1 compatibility report](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/releases/tag/kryo-parent-5.0.0-RC1#Compatibility) and those of the subsequent RCs.

Compatibility of 5.0.0 to RC9:

- Serialization compatible
  - Standard IO: Yes
  - Unsafe-based IO: Yes
- Binary compatible - Yes ([Details](https://rawgithub.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/master/compat_reports/kryo/5.0.0-RC9_to_5.0.0/compat_report.html))
- Source compatible - Yes ([Details](https://rawgithub.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/master/compat_reports/kryo/5.0.0-RC9_to_5.0.0/compat_report.html#Source))

name: kryo-5.0.0-RC5
body:
This is the 5th release candidate of the new major version of Kryo (see also the [RC1 release notes](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/releases/tag/kryo-parent-5.0.0-RC1) for major changes of v5).

This RC comes with several improvements over the previous RCs, e.g. there's now a completely self-contained, versioned artifact with zero dependencies for usage of Kryo in libraries.
The full list of changes from RC4 to RC5 can be found [here](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/compare/kryo-parent-5.0.0-RC4...kryo-parent-5.0.0-RC5).

name: kryo-5.0.0-RC4
body: This is a hotfix release over RC3, just removing a forgotten `println`. For the rest see the [release notes for RC3](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/releases/tag/kryo-parent-5.0.0-RC3)

name: kryo-5.0.0-RC3
body:
This is the third release candidate of the new major version of Kryo, which fixes many issues and makes many long awaited improvements (see also the [RC1 release notes](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/releases/tag/kryo-parent-5.0.0-RC1)).

This RC comes with fixes and approvements over the previous RCs: [here's what changed from RC2 to RC3](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/compare/kryo-parent-5.0.0-RC2...kryo-parent-5.0.0-RC3)

For migration from previous major versions please check out the [migration guide](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/wiki/Migration-to-v5). We're asking the community to help and contribute this part: please edit the migration wiki page as you encounter any information or issues that might help others.

This RC may be the last one asking for feedback before 5.0.0. If you think you found a bug, please submit an issue. If you think something should be changed before 5.0.0 is released, please post on the mailing list.

### Compatibility
Due to big changes 5.0.0 is both source/binary incompatible and serialization incompatible to previous major versions - for details see [the RC1 compatibility report](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/releases/tag/kryo-parent-5.0.0-RC1#Compatibility).

Compatibility of 5.0.0-RC3 to RC2:

- Serialization compatible
  - Standard IO: Yes
  - Unsafe-based IO: Yes
- Binary compatible - No ([Details](https://rawgithub.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/master/compat_reports/kryo/5.0.0-RC2_to_5.0.0-RC3/compat_report.html))
- Source compatible - No ([Details](https://rawgithub.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/master/compat_reports/kryo/5.0.0-RC2_to_5.0.0-RC3/compat_report.html#Source))

name: kryo-5.0.0-RC1
body:
This is the first release candidate of the new major version of Kryo, which fixes many issues and makes many long awaited improvements.

For details see [this mailing list thread](https://groups.google.com/d/msg/kryo-users/sBZ10dwrwFQ/hb6FF5ZXCQAJ) or check out the [changes from 4.0.2 to 5.0.0-RC1](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/compare/kryo-parent-4.0.2...kryo-parent-5.0.0-RC1).

So far there is only a minimal migration guide. We're asking the community to help and contribute this part: please edit the [migration wiki page](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/wiki/Migration-to-v5) as you encounter any information or issues that might help others.

With the release candidate we're looking for feedback. If you think you found a bug, please submit an issue. If you think something should be changed before 5.0.0 is released, please post on the [mailing list](https://groups.google.com/d/msg/kryo-users/).

### Compatibility
Due to big changes it is both source/binary incompatible and serialization incompatible.

- Serialization compatible
  - Standard IO: No
  - Unsafe-based IO: No
- Binary compatible - No ([Details](https://rawgithub.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/master/compat_reports/kryo/4.0.2_to_5.0.0-RC1/compat_report.html))
- Source compatible - No ([Details](https://rawgithub.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/master/compat_reports/kryo/4.0.2_to_5.0.0-RC1/compat_report.html#Source))

name: kryo-4.0.2
body:
This is a maintenance release coming with fixes and improvements.
* #567: Use public member instead of private field to resolve immutability for serializer ([bceef26](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/bceef260a763ce163fb5ff1c38358b6e324c6094))
* Fix #558, #549: IdentityObjectIntMap.clear taking more time - Realloc instead of clearing large maps ([77935c6](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/77935c696ee4976963aa5c6ac53d53d9b40b8bdd))
* Fix #539, #554: Fix crash when removing multiple fields with CompatibleFieldSerializer ([56fb1a1](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/56fb1a1cf44dfd60ed22e1e92913f189b7095400))
* #530: Fix #529 Support serializing the Enum class object ([033d659](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/033d659a118d7206dfa8d9c605bcec601c46f116))

Many thanks to all contributors! 

### Compatibility
- Serialization compatible
  - Standard IO: Yes
  - Unsafe-based IO: Yes
- Binary compatible - Yes ([Details](https://rawgithub.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/master/compat_reports/kryo/4.0.1_to_4.0.2/compat_report.html))
- Source compatible - Yes ([Details](https://rawgithub.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/master/compat_reports/kryo/4.0.1_to_4.0.2/compat_report.html#Source))

name: kryo-4.0.1
body:
This is a maintenance release coming with fixes and improvements.

* #527: Add documentation on very large object graphs ([67a3499](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/67a349979ce31313c442d6cab86e6e73044f7e95))
* #516: Use relatively safe max size of java array ([389d33a](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/389d33a2bbf7cd89a9e1249ab48e777243f9b465))
* #521: Use chunked encoding for TaggedFieldSerializer forward compatibility (fixes #442), replaces ignoreUnknownTags with skipUnknownTags, use chunked encoding ([6dc6aa5](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/6dc6aa511fde8375ce1453aa04df3c71b671b493))
* Fix #500: Push java source/target version to 1.7 ([c1ff83c](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/c1ff83c89e36a13a39f6bb712c3546aa667ff3b2))
* Deprecate Util.isAndroid, superseded by the final Util.IS_ANDROID ([64d7784](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/64d7784fac8588fcdc4b3574de77b21265c2ad77))
* #514: Fix warning on instantiate object on Android N+ - update Objenesis to the latest version 2.5.1 ([4050fc9](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/4050fc97c60f647187cd8c9302f1ce8bf2b07154), [6040efd](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/6040efd2a60c2a266f3ef0524bdd0cd9b20cdd78))
* #520: Correctly deserialize objects when fields are added to a Class with enough fields to trigger binary search in CompatibleFieldSerializer ([d31e2bf](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/d31e2bf295eb1943fe9297685a9ee708e0bca1e8))
* #518: error message for problems with anonymous classes ([0eb7b71](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/0eb7b71b8ba26e08605a51ec2849d6f9267c2b2b))
* #509: Clarify default used registrations ([75a41a6](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/75a41a659a709055fe5487ab34d1b2408e15b255))
* #441: Check for overlapping tags. ([763ce88](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/763ce88cfc1f11e97b62dc7ebc6ed12081abc638))
* Fix #503: writeAscii_slow should be able to write at least one byte into the output buffer. ([c3ed14c](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/c3ed14c10caf61a99492391e43f9812baedb84b4))
* #486: Fix IdentityMap constructor ([968c240](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/968c2404e9f8e64ffb2bc1b5eb24219e92f1bf81))
* #483: Override ObjectInputStream ClassLoader ([19a6b5e](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/19a6b5edee7125fbaf54c64084a8d0e13509920b))
* #465: Fix growing ByteBufferOutput while writing varint ([e721a44](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/e721a44e44025949abb1395ae9aa28ec1bdd9cea))
* Fix #450: Update to the latest clirr-maven-plugin ([6b8cb36](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/6b8cb36f5ac080b29b746fa1d8f8573ba85826ed))

Many thanks to all contributors! 

### Compatibility
- Serialization compatible
  - Standard IO: Yes
  - Unsafe-based IO: Yes
- Binary compatible - Yes ([Details](https://rawgithub.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/master/compat_reports/kryo/4.0.0_to_4.0.1/compat_report.html))
- Source compatible - Yes ([Details](https://rawgithub.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/master/compat_reports/kryo/4.0.0_to_4.0.1/compat_report.html#Source))

name: kryo-4.0.0
body:
- [BREAKING] Generics handling is more robust now, the former optimization for smaller size (but increased serialization time) is now optional and disabled by default.
**Important:** This change breaks the serialization format of the `FieldSerializer` for generic fields, therefore generic classes serialized with Kryo 3 and `FieldSerializer` cannot be deserialized with Kryo 4 by default. To deserialize such Kryo 3 serialized generic classes you have to set `kryo.getFieldSerializerConfig().setOptimizedGenerics(true);`!
For details see #433: Disable the optimization of generics serialization and provide an API for enabling/disabling it ([9923d05](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/9923d054c6262efca380b675f965b41c5814398e)).
This improves/fixes #377 "Kryo does not correctly support parameterized type hierarchy", #384 "ClassCastException When Writing a Map After Previously Reading a Map with Different Generic Type" - #424 Fixed (Compatible)FieldSerializer inheritance issue ([5a7b7c5](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/5a7b7c570e7e51c030341b4c2b51c2d8395e996e)) - Update reflectasm to latest version, reduction of synchronization ([132456e](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/132456edebaf28b96b91ba773f05c230b521cec6), [d77c752](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/d77c75246850a3c027f8427f0ba978c540910c45)) - #352 Add forward compatibility to TaggedFieldSerializer ([93bff2d](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/93bff2d63c30213506db8ab562a57e59e00ef409)) - #418 Add checks to setting output buffer and throw IllegalArgumentException when setting a buffer size greater than the max buffer size ([d57e00c](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/d57e00c20cd9d2742beda50ea114f4002ef18611)) - #417 Make FieldSerializer.serializeTransient usable ([8aae38d](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/8aae38d9bb4a67940006d84e5dc818329c698fd4)) - [BREAKING] #415 Make Closure public, moving it to ClosureSerializer ([bf80397](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/bf803974ba6351d993093636aac00245f1ec28bc), [6c402d9](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/6c402d9b14f09c81e5012c7071b0d430013a7374)) Fixes #299 "Can't register ClosureSerializer" - #414 Introduce FieldSerializerConfig to encapsulate config in Kryo ([4a47981](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/4a47981deec42dcfdf1679e6f5075a3d58bd9b60)) - Fix #412: Add default serializer for java.net.URL ([c10fd76](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/c10fd763504cf76a87106c3d647c8aadea0cd5e7)) - #404 Use system property to detect Android ([c238f97](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/c238f970e7300dd6b4b236bc626b98bd78aa7907)) - #396 Adds Charset serializer, also set as default serializer ([d7e924b](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/d7e924b09bf67bd9ba1e7a5715ad0051bfe79607)) Resolves #364 "Few of the java Charsets classes from rt.jar can not be deserialized" - #395 Adds support for java 8 java.time.\* classes ([aff0689](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/aff06892463104a1805fcaa5b0220a4ac22582e0)) - [BREAKING] #392 Move Generics{,Resolver} to serializers, reduce public api ([e22ffb8](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/e22ffb8d8badf0ae420ab1d2a0ea045527fe38d8)) - #400 Modified utility hash maps to gracefully handle very large number of entries. ([2b8e6fd](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/2b8e6fddddd7a468f240ea59f90ef1dc2566a0cf)) Resolves #382 "Kryo breaks down while serializing genomic data" - Adds serializers for java8 Optional{Int,Long,Double} ([fb65ee9](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/fb65ee93f48f74461d87cab05e607a427dad7269)) - #362 Add java8 support and serializer for java.util.Optional ([12229ca](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/12229ca6d7c9f63018d91055301efb36ecb6d048)) - #393 Fix #389 revert ByteOrder on overflow in require during writeVar_() during writeVar_() ([7d840a0](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/7d840a0a5f94a8c8aca0ea1c0796ab5ff48381da)) - #394 Fix positioning and order updates in ByteBufferInput and ByteBufferOutput ([88f5875](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/88f587556580387513241a78d057940d1525d627)) - #388 Resolve #386: Automatically test serialization compatibility ([c904c7e](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/c904c7eca8298ed700be43917afc4dc089c803a5)) - #375 Fix #370 copyTransient is not global ([8414444](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/8414444c4d7876dd4b8336f650a964f93fcb688a), [481ddf4](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/481ddf48d1964b8fabd45f40863d24c6e9ac22e8), [1ada47d](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/1ada47dfe9bd49cb644fa81fea5b05d15321cb90)) - #368) Try to load classes with fallback that uses current ClassLoader. ([8dee484](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/8dee4845e12bec2b985a379983b77f04dc02967c)) - Update objenesis to 2.2 ([ba67801](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/ba67801b8de9a03e8f034f99773c99118728b66e)) - #359 Use binary search to find field in CompatibleFieldSerializer for object with lots of fields ([8678e50](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/8678e50423d5f70985f6709f5b46652a5dda0d2d)) - Fixed #346 Issue resizing UnsafeMemoryOutput on OSX 10.10.5 ([50d1a6f](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/50d1a6f4bd22bce210c13ecb57eb64047683ec81)) - Fixed bug #340 KryoException: Encountered unregistered class ID: ([2fdf64e](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/2fdf64e28eb6e58e390e44da31cd357448aa190a)) - #344 Propagate flush to underlying stream ([b3d6bda](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/b3d6bda2e2ca95455c8261af75004f3de2d6dd27)) - #342 Prevent creation of cyclic Generics stack when serializing specific generics object trees - #337/#338 ByteBufferInputStream violates InputStream contract ([cf06241](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/cf06241348546bc1246b73f1fd2e3e5e5266f57f)) - #297 Warn unregistered classes option ([fd7d1b2](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/commit/fd7d1b2f6c41b5140a7d783843411feabeffe60f)) Here's the list of [all commits since 3.0.3](https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/compare/kryo-parent-3.0.3...kryo-parent-4.0.0) And most importantly; many thanks to all contributors! ### Compatibility - Serialization compatible - Standard IO: No (format for generic fields written by `FieldSerializer` changed, compatibility can be achieved with `kryo.getFieldSerializerConfig().setOptimizedGenerics(true);`) - Unsafe-based IO: No (format for generic fields written by `FieldSerializer` changed, compatibility can be achieved with `kryo.getFieldSerializerConfig().setOptimizedGenerics(true);`) - Binary compatible - No ([Details](https://rawgithub.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/master/compat_reports/kryo/3.0.3_to_4.0.0/compat_report.html)) - Source compatible - No ([Details](https://rawgithub.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/master/compat_reports/kryo/3.0.3_to_4.0.0/compat_report.html#Source))
